# ECON 304: Money & Banking

## Course Overview

This course provides a comprehensive introduction to monetary economics, the financial system, and the Federal Reserve's role in managing the U.S. economy. You'll explore interest rate determination, money supply mechanisms, banking systems, and how monetary policy influences economic activity.

### Learning Objectives

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

- Understand the structure and function of the Federal Reserve System
- Analyze interest rate determination and the term structure of interest rates
- Explain how banks create money and the money supply process
- Evaluate the transmission mechanisms of monetary policy
- Assess the effectiveness of monetary policy tools
- Apply financial economic principles to real-world banking and policy decisions
